title: Broiled Sole With Mustard Sauce
summary: Broiled Sole With Mustard Sauce requires about 19 minutes from start to finish. For $14.76 per serving, this recipe covers 40% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 1. This main course has 629 calories, 87g of protein, and 24g of fat per serving. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. A mixture of mayonnaise, dijon mustard, sole fillets, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. To use up the lemon you could follow this main course with the Lemon Shortbread Cookies with Lemon Icing {A Tribute to Aunt Roxanne} as a dessert. It is brought to you by Recipezaar. Taking all factors into account, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 74%, which is pretty good. Try Broiled Sole With Mustard Sauce, Broiled Sole With Mustard And Thyme, and Broiled Tilapia with Mustard Chive Sauce for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. You could try Rabble Pinot Gris. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.9 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Rabble Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Alsatian-inspired with notes of lime, green apple, white flower and wetstone. Following the nose are flavors of Anjou pear, white nectarine andcitrus. The vibrant and crisp acidity balances out this medium bodied wineand carries it through the lingering finish.

instructions: Coat a baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray.Arrange fillets so they don't overlap.In a small bowl, combine the mayonnaise, mustard, parsley, and pepper and mix thoroughly.Spread the mixture evenly over the fillets.Broil 3 to 4 inches from the heat for 4 minutes until fish flakes easily with a fork.Arrange fillets on a serving platter, garnish with lemon wedges, and serve.

steps.step: Coat a baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray.Arrange fillets so they don't overlap.In a small bowl, combine the mayonnaise, mustard, parsley, and pepper and mix thoroughly.

Spread the mixture evenly over the fillets.Broil 3 to 4 inches from the heat for 4 minutes until fish flakes easily with a fork.Arrange fillets on a serving platter, garnish with lemon wedges, and serve.
